articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The United States, joined by Arab mediators, sought on Wednesday to conclude an agreement between Israel and Hamas to halt the 14-month-old war in the Gaza Strip where medics said Israeli strikes killed at least 16 Palestinians overnight.
articles.title: Gaza mediators intensify ceasefire efforts, Israeli strikes kill 16 people

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Wednesday it had detained a citizen of Uzbekistan who had confessed to planting a bomb which killed Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov in Moscow a day earlier on the instructions of Ukraine's security service.
articles.title: Russia says it detains suspect over the murder of top general in Moscow

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea said on Thursday its military alliance with Russia is proving "very effective" in deterring the United States and its "vassal forces," denouncing a recent statement by Washington and allies against growing ties between Pyongyang and Moscow.
articles.title: North Korea says its alliance with Russia 'very effective,' no mention of troop losses

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: European Union leaders aim to send a "clear signal" to U.S. President-elect Donald Trump at a summit on Thursday about their continued support for Ukraine and will also discuss the security and economic challenges posed by his return to the White House.
articles.title: EU leaders to send 'clear message' to Trump on Ukraine, to debate U.S. ties

articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: Around late September, staff manning the phones at 39 19, France's main anonymous hotline for women who are victims of violence, began noticing a new type of case.
articles.title: Pelicot rape trial shifts France's practices around drug-facilitated assaults

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two Malaysians who were detained in Guantanamo Bay since 2006 have safely arrived in Malaysia and will undergo a rehabilitation process before being reintegrated into society, state news agency Bernama reported on Wednesday, citing the Inspector-General of Police Razarudin Husain.
articles.title: Two Guantanamo Bay detainees back in Malaysia, will undergo rehabilitation, Bernama reports

articles.author: Rich McKay, Joseph Ax
articles.description: A 14-year-old girl and a teacher at her private Christian school were named by Wisconsin authorities on Wednesday night as the victims of a school shooter earlier this week.
articles.title: Fourteen-year-old girl among those killed in Wisconsin school shooting

articles.author: Krishna N. Das
articles.description: Bangladesh's interim government has accused energy supplier Adani Power of breaching a multi-billion-dollar agreement by withholding tax benefits that a power plant central to the deal received from New Delhi, according to documents seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Adani, under bribery scrutiny, pressed by Bangladesh to reopen power deal

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States voiced alarm at the United Nations Security Council on Wednesday that Russia was close to accepting a nuclear-armed North Korea, as Moscow and Pyongyang defended their growing cooperation.
articles.title: US alarmed Russia close to accepting nuclear-armed North Korea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam is seeking to expand its international defence cooperation to build trust and prevent wars, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh said on Thursday at the opening of Vietnam's second international arms fair.
articles.title: Vietnam PM says arms expo is a message of peace, cooperation and development
